info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 27 at 6:33AM CDT until July 27 at 8:30AM CDT by NWS St Louis MO
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of southwest Illinois, including the following counties, northern Calhoun, southern Greene and Jersey and northeast Missouri, including the following county, southeastern Pike.
* WHEN...Until 830 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 633 AM CDT, emergency management reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 5 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Godfrey, Jerseyville, Carrollton, Brighton, Hardin, Grafton, Elsah, West Alton, Clarksville, Old Kane, Belleview, Kemper, Kane, Kampsville, Fieldon, Eldred, Hamburg, Otterville, Fidelity and Paynesville.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM CDT THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING

area.areaDesc: Calhoun, IL; Greene, IL; Jersey, IL; Pike, MO
